title.narrative: Advocacy for National Cohesion and Environmental Sustainability (ANaCES)

description.narrative: The proposed project is designed specifically to consolidate the regional divide orchestrated through the national political activities ignited because of elections and build climate change resilience in Sierra Leone. The project is embedded with three prone intentions which are: -Capacitate the IRCSL to enhance their functions in administrative skills and development context intervention. -Strengthen social and national cohesion to prevent election prone conflict for 2023. -Improve climate resilience, the issues of water facility and environmental issues in the country. The entire project concept is linked to CAFOD’s primary thematic programmes which include: -Governance, Accountability and Transparency - Capacity Strengthening -Livelihood, Resilience and Environment The project is well fit-in into the Freetown City Council’s Top-11 Priorities and government top priorities to consolidate national peace and climate change recovery. The project will be implemented by IRCSL with direct funding from CAFOD’s funding and CAFOD will continue to provide technical support and supervision to strengthen their organizational capacity and programme’s quality delivery. The project will be implemented across 15 districts in Sierra Leone targeting State institutions, Political Parties, Civil Societies, local stakeholders and other relevant bodies to promote national peace and environmental sustainability. The overarching goal of the project is to strengthen local and national institutional capacities for sustaining peace, national cohesion, and resilience towards climate change.
